Name: Amazon
Common Pitfalls: Ignoring Work Style consistency; overfitting to 'what they want' inconsistently; sloppy tests in coding.
Question Types: 2 coding problems (DSA patterns) + workplace scenarios (prioritization, customer focus) + preferences questionnaire
Sections (what shows up): Coding assessment + Work Simulation + Work Style Assessment (varies by role)
Tips (high ROI): Treat Work Simulation like leadership principles in action; for coding, optimize after correctness; write clean edge-case handling.

Name: Atlassian
Common Pitfalls: Spending too long perfecting first problem; missing edge cases; not reading constraints.
Question Types: Implementation-heavy + 1-2 DSA pattern problems; input parsing and correctness matter
Tips (high ROI): Prioritize full score on easy/medium; write robust parsing; build small helper functions; test quickly.

Name: TCS
Common Pitfalls: Over-investing time in one section; skipping instructions; weak typing/IO handling in coding.
Sections (what shows up): Foundation: Verbal + Reasoning + Numerical; Advanced: higher difficulty sections; Programming section (as applicable)
Tips (high ROI): Do sectional time-boxing; maximize accuracy in MCQ; for coding, aim at passing all sample + hidden edge cases.

Name: Google
Common Pitfalls: Jumping into code; unclear problem restatement; missing constraints.
Question Types: 1-2 algorithmic problems emphasizing clarity and correctness
Sections (what shows up): Coding assessment or take-home style screen (not universal)
Tips (high ROI): Write clear approach first; discuss complexity; handle edge cases explicitly; avoid premature micro-optimizations.

Name: Meta
Common Pitfalls: Silent coding; weak testing; no complexity discussion.
Sections (what shows up): Coding assessment (may precede phone screen in some pipelines)
Tips (high ROI): Drill common patterns (arrays/strings/hashmaps/graphs); practice communicating while coding.

Name: Microsoft
Common Pitfalls: Assuming one 'right' interpretation; not asking clarifying questions; ignoring constraints.
Sections (what shows up): Coding assessment may appear before recruiter or before phone screen (pipeline-dependent)
Tips (high ROI): Explain tradeoffs; write readable code; add tests; keep calm if prompt is underspecified.

Name: Uber
Common Pitfalls: Overengineering; weak edge cases; ignoring runtime constraints.
Question Types: Implementation + DSA; sometimes domain-flavored (data, maps, matching)
Tips (high ROI): Clarify input/output; write production-grade handling; mention tradeoffs; keep it simple.
